subject: Public Speaking
title: Humor Openings
description: A quick, practical guide to Humor Openings.

hook.text: A well-timed joke breaks ice. A bad joke freezes the room.

buildup.text: Opening humor shows confidence and builds likability instantly.

discovery.text: Self-deprecating humor is safest. It builds connection.

twist.text: Never joke at the audience's expense. That builds walls.

climax.text: Humor must relate to your topic. Random jokes distract.

punchline.text: Open with humor carefully. It warms the room.
